name: Black-Eyed Pea Gumbo
author: Lynn Blackwelder Patterson
summary: A winter time favorite at our house. We always have it for New Year's Day while we watch football! Serve with a tossed salad and corn bread.
ingredients: 4 (15 ounce) cans black-eyed peas with liquid
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles
directions: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, and cook the onion, pepper, and celery until tender
Pour in the chicken broth, and mix in rice, black-eyed peas with liquid, diced tomatoes and green chiles, diced tomatoes, and garlic
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 45 minutes, or until rice is tender
Add water if soup is too thick
